translation.en: They're trying to talk to the family, but they're not being cooperative with the detectives.

translation.en: I didn't like them. I didn't like them. Didn't…

translation.en: Didn't like them one bit and… you know, so…

translation.en: And I didn't get it, didn't understand.

translation.en: "My family had nothing to do with this."

translation.en: So then, you know, we opened up a little more, but…

translation.en: [Rick] There's a lot of rumors running around as to what might've happened. What are you thinking is…?

translation.en: [Belinda] I'm thinking there's been a lot of gang problems with that, uh, 5150.
translation.ja: 5150というギャングの もめ事が関係してると思う

translation.en: [Rick] This is what we call the West End.

translation.en: This kind of loop is where the actual shooting took place,

translation.en: but even more so where 5150 claim territory.

translation.en: So there's turf wars, and guys that see each other. There'll be conflict.

translation.en: [reporter] Rival Latino and Black gangs involved in drug trafficking…

translation.en: [Rick] 5150 kind of came into existence for us in Riverside around 2003, give or take.
translation.ja: 5150は2003年頃 リバーサイドで結成された

translation.en: They tried to establish themselves and made some inroads
translation.ja: 暴力的で強力な ギャングとしての―

translation.en: into being a particularly violent and confrontational gang,
translation.ja: 暴力的で強力な ギャングとしての― 地位を確立しようとしてた

translation.en: graduating to assaults, to shootings, to then, uh, murdering three people
translation.ja: ２〜３年の間に 暴行や銃撃を繰り返し

translation.en: within the city in the course of two and a half to three years.
translation.ja: ３人の殺人も犯している

translation.en: It was a very quick evolution.
translation.ja: 急激に大きくなってる

translation.en: [Mario] We're in Riverside now.
translation.ja: ここがリバーサイド

translation.en: All kinds of shootings, and every night people will get stabbed, robbed.
translation.ja: 銃撃もあるし 強奪されるのも日常茶飯事

translation.en: As soon as people heard 5150, like, they got scared.
translation.ja: 5150と聞くと みんな恐れる

translation.en: You know, they said we were murderers. We're killers.

translation.en: Never once did I ever think that society would look at us like that.

translation.en: Originally Riverside was, uh… It was kind of like an outcast from L.A.
translation.ja: リバーサイドは ＬＡの外れにある

translation.en: All the people that couldn't afford to live in L.A. or in Orange County,
translation.ja: ＬＡやオレンジ郡に 住めない人が

translation.en: they came out to Riverside.
translation.ja: リバーサイドに来た

translation.en: So a lot of, I would say poor people.
translation.ja: 貧しい人が多かった

translation.en: I don't think we ever even went to, like, the beach or Disneyland. Nothing like that ever.
translation.ja: ビーチやディズニーランドに 行ったことなど一度もない

translation.en: We never experienced anything outside of, like, that area. So we thought that that was life.

translation.en: Fifty-one, fifty, it was like me and my cousins or family members
translation.ja: 5150は僕やいとこ 家族が助け合う場だった 5150は僕やいとこ 家族が助け合う場だった マリオ

translation.en: backing each other up. That was the whole motive.
translation.ja: 5150は僕やいとこ 家族が助け合う場だった マリオ ただの家族の集まりだ

translation.en: Like, we're family. That was it.
translation.ja: ただの家族の集まりだ

translation.en: We would all be out here.
translation.ja: この辺にいた

translation.en: Nothing really happening.
translation.ja: 平和だった

translation.en: We were all under 18 years old, you know.
translation.ja: みんな18歳以下だった

translation.en: When we were kids, uh, you know, everybody targeted us.
translation.ja: だから子供の頃は 標的にされたよ

translation.en: [Rick] Give me a full description of this--

translation.en: [Belinda] He was young. He was young. He was a kid.
translation.ja: 警察の取り調べ ベリンダ･レーン 若い子よ　ただの子供

translation.en: -But if I see him, I will know him. -[Rick] Okay.

translation.en: [Belinda] Then there was more interviews and looking at pictures.
translation.ja: さらに取り調べを受けて 写真を見た

translation.en: [Rick] This particular binder has got all the different gang members.
translation.ja: ギャングメンバーの写真だ

translation.en: And it kind of helps me to keep track of who's who in the zoo.
translation.ja: 誰がメンバーか分かる

translation.en: I do remember Belinda telling me the shooter had been a really young,
translation.ja: ベリンダの話によると 犯人はかなり若い

translation.en: almost white-looking Hispanic guy, like a real baby face.
translation.ja: ベリンダの話によると 犯人はかなり若い 色白のヒスパニックで 童顔らしい

translation.en: She saw his face, and she'd absolutely be able to identify him. Wouldn't be a problem.

translation.en: This is the sketch that was drawn based off the information provided by Belinda.

translation.en: I looked through annuals, yearbooks,
translation.ja: アルバムを確認した

translation.en: looking for people who are gang members and have a current picture I can look at.

translation.ja: ベリンダに 写真を見てほしいと頼んだ

translation.en: She starts going through the pictures. And she gets to a young kid.
translation.ja: 彼女は写真を確認して ある子に目を留めた

translation.en: And she stops
translation.ja: そして言った

translation.en: and says, "That's him."
translation.ja: “この子だ”と

translation.en: One day Detective Wheeler called and said that, uh,
translation.ja: ウィーラー刑事から 連絡があった

translation.en: they have somebody they think might be involved in it,
translation.ja: 容疑者を 見つけたかもしれないと

translation.en: and if they could drive me down there to get a look at him.
translation.ja: それで私に見てほしいと

translation.en: And she IDs him. "That's him. That's the guy."
translation.ja: 彼女は言った “その子だ”と

translation.en: [Rick] You doing okay, dude?
translation.ja: 大丈夫？

translation.en: We start pressing him on this case and ask him where he was,
translation.ja: 事件の日どこにいたのか 聞くと

translation.en: and he's given us a particular alibi as to where he was, who he was with.
translation.ja: アリバイや誰といたのか 詳しく話した

translation.en: [suspect] I wasn't there.
translation.ja: 僕じゃない

translation.en: [Rick] I know that you were, though. I got somebody who identified you.
translation.ja: 君がいたと 証言してる人がいる

translation.en: I'm telling him, "We're gonna check this out." "Don't lie. I'll find out if you're lying to me."
translation.ja: 彼に言った　“ウソをつくな すぐバレるぞ”

translation.en: We were at my house, and then we went to his brother's girlfriend's house.
translation.ja: みんな僕の家にいて 友達の兄の彼女の家に行った

translation.en: [Ricky] He's saying, "I wasn't there."
translation.ja: 彼は否定した

translation.en: "I was over at a friend's house. I was with a friend. You can call them."
translation.ja: 〝友達の家にいた 確認してもいい〞と

translation.en: "You can check with them." I get a couple of my partners
translation.ja: 〝友達の家にいた 確認してもいい〞と 同僚にアリバイの 裏付けを頼んだ

translation.en: to go over and verify his alibi.
translation.ja: 同僚にアリバイの 裏付けを頼んだ

translation.en: And it's solid.
translation.ja: 本当だった

translation.en: [suspect crying] Please!
translation.ja: お願いだよ！

translation.en: Let me go home! [crying] Let me go gome.
translation.ja: 帰らせてよ 家に帰りたい

translation.en: [Rick] So now I'm starting to think, "Uh-oh, I got a bad ID here?"
translation.ja: 間違いなのかもと 思い始めた

translation.en: "That's not a good start."
translation.ja: 幸先が悪い

translation.en: And we ended up sending him home.
translation.ja: 結局 彼を家に帰した

translation.en: They really didn't explain things to me well enough,
translation.ja: ちゃんと説明されなかった

translation.en: like you make one mistake and identify somebody that's not involved,
translation.ja: 例えば 関係者でないと 一度 断定してしまうと―

translation.en: they can no longer use what you have to say when it comes to court.
translation.ja: 法廷では証言として 使えなくなるとか

translation.en: So that complicated the case for the detective.
translation.ja: そのせいで複雑になった

translation.en: You start off with a case very optimistic. We'll handle this. This is gonna get done.
translation.ja: すぐに解決できると 最初は楽観的だった

translation.en: Then you reach a point to where there aren't any more leads,
translation.ja: それが手がかりがゼロになり

translation.en: and… and now it's almost a war of attrition.
translation.ja: それが手がかりがゼロになり 消耗戦になってきた

translation.en: [Belinda] And I promised her.
translation.ja: 娘に誓った

translation.en: It was the last thing I got to say to her, besides "I love you."
translation.ja: 最後に“愛してる”と 伝えた後 誓った

translation.en: I promised her that I was gonna get him
translation.ja: 犯人を捕まえると

translation.en: if it's the last thing I do. I'm gonna get him. They're gonna pay.
translation.ja: 絶対に捕まえて償わせると

translation.en: [Jaimie] I guess I was, uh, talking to Nick on MySpace,
translation.ja: 〝クリスタルを殺した ５１５０の男は〞 マイスペースで ニックが教えてくれた マイスペースで ニックが教えてくれた マイスペースで ニックが教えてくれた 〝マイスペースに いるらしい〞

translation.en: and he had told me how the guys,
translation.ja: 事件に関係した男たちが マイスペースを持ってると

translation.en: the people involved, had MySpace.
translation.ja: 事件に関係した男たちが マイスペースを持ってると 事件に関係した男たちが マイスペースを持ってると ニック　クリスタルの弟 ジェイミー

translation.en: He said, "They all have profiles."
translation.ja: ニック　クリスタルの弟 ジェイミー プロフィールがあると

translation.en: [Nick] I pretty much, like, knew it was 5150 already.
translation.ja: 〝クリスタルの 友人リストに入ってる〞 〝クリスタルの 友人リストに入ってる〞 5150が犯人だと気付いてた

translation.en: You know the streets talk, like, you just hear stuff.
translation.ja: 噂が耳に入ってくる

translation.en: I mean, little by little you find out.
translation.ja: 少しずつ分かる

translation.en: I was young. I was just a kid when she passed away.
translation.ja: 姉が亡くなった時 俺は13歳くらいだった

translation.en: I was maybe 13 years old, so at that time when that happened,
translation.ja: 姉が亡くなった時 俺は13歳くらいだった ギャングのことも 知らなかった

translation.en: I didn't really know about gangs.
translation.ja: ギャングのことも 知らなかった

translation.en: [Jaimie] I talked to Aunt Belinda. I said,
translation.ja: ベリンダおばさんに言った

translation.en: "MySpace. I can go on there. I can search for you." "Get information for you."
translation.ja: “マイスペースで 情報を集められる”と

translation.en: [Belinda] I knew nothing about the social media. I wasn't on the MySpace.
translation.ja: ソーシャルメディアのことは 何も知らなかった

translation.en: She said, "How do you do it?" I said, "I can do it all. Don't worry."
translation.ja: “どうやるの？”と聞かれた 私は“任せて”と

translation.en: I was 14.
translation.ja: 私は14歳だった

translation.en: About to turn 15.
translation.ja: ほとんど15歳

translation.en: [Lauer] If you've got a teenager at home, chances are that he or she spends a lot of time
translation.ja: マイスペースという ソーシャルメディアに

translation.en: on the social networking website called MySpace.com.
translation.ja: 10代の子供たちは 夢中のようです

translation.en: I knew everything about it. The ins and outs.
translation.ja: 私は何でも知っていた

translation.en: How to make it look like this, how to make this pop up in your text,
translation.ja: 背景を変えたり 写真を動かしたり

translation.en: how to make colored text, everything.
translation.ja: 色を変えたり

translation.en: [reporter] With 66 million users nationwide,
translation.ja: ユーザーは6600万人

translation.en: MySpace is one of the most popular networking sites used by kids.
translation.ja: 若者に人気の ソーシャルメディアです

translation.en: Most of the kids at my school use MySpace. You put pictures up. Meet girls, guys.
translation.ja: みんなマイスペースに 写真をあげて交流してる

translation.en: It was brand-new, popular. Everyone wanted to be on it.
translation.ja: 新しくて人気があった

translation.en: I was obsessed with it.
translation.ja: 夢中になった

translation.en: I was excited. You want to give me this chance? You want to give me responsibility?
translation.ja: またとないチャンスと責任に 興奮した

translation.en: I thought to myself, "How can I snoop better?"
translation.ja: それで考えた “どうやって探ればいい？”

translation.en: [Belinda] So Jaimie Googled a picture and found a pretty girl.
translation.ja: ジェイミーはかわいい 画像を検索した

translation.en: [Jaimie] She had a Supergirl shirt on. I was like, "You're gonna be my Supergirl."
translation.ja: スーパーガールの Ｔシャツの子に決めた

translation.en: I just wanted a pretty face, a pretty body,
translation.ja: かわいい顔と魅力的な肉体

translation.en: and it was gonna be my brain behind it.
translation.ja: 私が操作する

translation.en: [Belinda] And we named her Rebecca, and we posted that up.
translation.ja: レベッカと名付けて 写真をあげた

translation.en: [Jaimie] I made her in the eyes of what I thought the gang members would like.
translation.ja: ギャングの好みに合わせた

translation.en: Added in, "Smoke weed, and I like to drink beer."
translation.ja: “マリフアナを吸う ビールを飲む”

translation.en: But I said cerveza because I thought it was more clever.
translation.ja: ビールの代わりに セルヴェサにした

translation.en: I wanted them to 100% think, "This girl on this MySpace is real."
translation.ja: マイスペースのこの子が 実在するように演出した

translation.en: I had the top eight.
translation.ja: “８人の親友”とつなげて

translation.en: I befriended all of them. Clicked on that person's profile,
translation.ja: “８人の親友”とつなげて それぞれの“８人の親友”も 友達リストに加えた

translation.en: went to their top eight, added all of their top eight.
translation.ja: それぞれの“８人の親友”も 友達リストに加えた

translation.en: You got clicked, and everyone got clicked, and everyone got added,
translation.ja: みんなクリックして 追加された

translation.en: and I just kept adding and adding until I had a MySpace full of guys
translation.ja: どんどん追加して5150の メンバーでいっぱいになった

translation.en: that were 5150, and it looked like I belonged.
translation.ja: どんどん追加して5150の メンバーでいっぱいになった 私も一員よ

translation.en: I said, "Aunt Belinda, I got it set up. What do you want me to do?"
translation.ja: ベリンダおばさんに 何をしたいか聞くと

translation.en: "Get as much information as you can."
translation.ja: “できるだけ 情報を集めて”と

translation.en: [Jaimie] I was making them like me. Just making them trust me.
translation.ja: 私を好きになってもらい 信用してもらう

translation.en: [Belinda] They don't even spell a word out. I had to ask, I go, "What does LOL mean?"
translation.ja: 略語を使う　“ＬＯＬ(（笑）)”の 意味も分からなかった

translation.en: My typing was acting. That's what my acting was.
translation.ja: タイピングが私の演技だった

translation.en: [Belinda] Just trying to find out where they were from, what they were doing.
translation.ja: 彼らがどこの出身で 何してるのか調べた

translation.en: Of course, I knew that they were driving a white Ford Expedition that night.
translation.ja: 白いエクスペディションに 乗ってる人物

translation.en: She wanted me to start prying for information real quick.
translation.ja: おばさんは すぐに探るよう言った

translation.en: And I was like, "No, no, no, I gotta play it out." "Let me do this in, like, a week."
translation.ja: 私は１週間か最低でも３日は 時間を置きたいと言った

translation.en: Give me three days at least before I start being like, "Hey, what car do you drive?"
translation.ja: “どんな車に乗ってる？”と いきなり聞けない

translation.en: Okay. He had the white Ford Expedition.
translation.ja: いいわ 白いエクスペディションに 乗ってた

translation.en: Yeah, two of them.
translation.ja: ２台あった

translation.en: That even made it even more confusing too.
translation.ja: それで余計 混乱した

translation.en: With the witnesses and everybody, because the two vehicles the same color.
translation.ja: 目撃情報によると ２台の車は同じ色だった

translation.en: I… I remember at some point early on, we talked about the vehicles in the area.
translation.ja: 捜査の初期の段階で 車について話した

translation.en: Okay, this one's Robbie.
translation.ja: これはロビー

translation.en: [Rick] Neighbors had seen a couple of vehicles. Some described them as SUVs,
translation.ja: 隣人は２台のＳＵＶを 目撃してた

translation.en: like Expeditions or something of that nature.
translation.ja: エクスペディションのような

translation.en: They were parked right here.
translation.ja: ここに駐車してた

translation.en: [Rick] Doing laps in the area almost as if they were chasing each other.
translation.ja: その地域を回って 競争していたようだ

translation.en: I remember asking them about that. "You saw it? Know what happened?"
translation.ja: それを見たか彼らに尋ねた

translation.en: "You were getting in your cars to go somewhere else about the time that these vehicles were speeding through the area."
translation.ja: 車が暴走している頃に 彼らは車に乗り込んでた

translation.en: And I can remember them playing kind of dumb about it.
translation.ja: 彼らは知らないふりを していたと思う

translation.en: Yeah, there… there was a little bit. Um…
translation.ja: 確かにそうね

translation.en: I didn't come forth with everything that I knew right away.
translation.ja: 知ってることを すぐには打ち明けなかった

translation.en: [Rick] Where was Robert when this happened?

translation.en: [Belinda] Robert? I don't know. Robert had nothing to do with this.
translation.ja: 警察の取り調べ ベリンダ･レーン ロビー？　知らない 息子は関係ない

translation.en: [Rick] Sure. Sure.
translation.ja: そうか

translation.en: [interviewer] So you tell the story of that night, you don't mention Robbie.
translation.ja: 事件の日のことを話した時 ロビーの話はしてない？

translation.en: [Belinda] Oh, yeah, because that had happened before,
translation.ja: ロビー･シオボルド ベリンダの息子 それは少し前の 出来事だったから

translation.en: but then that just kind of went out the door. I mean, I wasn't even thinking about where Robbie went.
translation.ja: 急なことでロビーの 行き先なんて考えてなかった

translation.en: I went to go find Robbie.
translation.ja: ロビーを捜した

translation.en: And we were getting ready to go to the store, and--
translation.ja: コンビニに行く準備をしてた

translation.en: It turned out later on that the older brother, Robert, was actually one of the vehicles being chased,
translation.ja: ロビーの車が追われてたと 後で分かった

translation.en: and they didn't offer that up for quite a while.
translation.ja: 長い間 教えてくれなかった

translation.en: [Rick] So this whole thing starts with Robbie
translation.ja: 銃撃の５分前 ロビーが実家の向かいに 車を止めて

translation.en: parked almost directly across from his parents' house,
translation.ja: 銃撃の５分前 銃撃の５分前 友達と話した所から 全てが始まった 友達と話した所から 全てが始まった

translation.en: talking to a friend.
translation.ja: 友達と話した所から 全てが始まった

translation.en: I pulled up to his house, and, um, my buddy came out.
translation.ja: 車を止めると友達が出てきた

translation.en: He's just in the passenger window talking to me.
translation.ja: 窓越しに彼と話をした

translation.en: And, uh, my girlfriend, she kind of got, like, she had a look on her face.
translation.ja: 俺の彼女は 不満そうな顔をしてた

translation.en: And, uh, there was an Expedition behind us.
translation.ja: エクスペディションが 後ろにいた

translation.en: And I looked at my buddy, and he was kind of getting spooked, and kind of backpedaling back up to the house.
translation.ja: 友達は驚いて 家に帰ろうとしてた

translation.en: I did have an eerie feeling like I don't know these people. I don't…
translation.ja: イヤな感じがした 知らない奴らだし―

translation.en: I don't have these problems in life, man, you know? Um…
translation.ja: 俺には関係ないことだ

translation.en: I turned on my brights, and, uh, I just gunned it.
translation.ja: ライトをつけて アクセルを踏んだ

translation.en: [Robbie] I thought I'd hit them or the curb,
translation.ja: 車か縁石に ぶつけようとしたけど

translation.en: like something was bound to go wrong. And I slid around the corner.
translation.ja: 車か縁石に ぶつけようとしたけど 角でスリップした

translation.en: And immediately they started chasing me.
translation.ja: 追いかけてきた

translation.en: [Rick] You were not in an SUV that night?
translation.ja: ＳＵＶに乗ってた？

translation.en: -[Robbie] No. -[Rick] Absolutely not?
translation.ja: 警察の取り調べ ロビー･シオボルド 乗ってない 警察の取り調べ ロビー･シオボルド

translation.en: I can't tell you how many people saw two SUVs that night.
translation.ja: 警察の取り調べ ロビー･シオボルド ＳＵＶの目撃情報がある ＳＵＶの目撃情報がある

translation.en: Realize, Robert, that I am here to help your family. That's all our jobs.
translation.ja: 君の家族を助けたい それが私たちの仕事

translation.en: [Robbie] I'm gone. I don't think it's an issue. Whatever it was, it's gone.
translation.ja: 俺は消えた　特に問題だとは 思わなかった

translation.en: I head over towards my daughter's mom's house.
translation.ja: 娘の母親の家に向かった

translation.en: And, uh, I get there, and I pull up, and she's all hysterical.
translation.ja: 目的地について車を止めた 彼女はイライラしてた

translation.en: [sighs] I think we started doing some follow-up on… the family.
translation.ja: そこで家族について 調べることにした

translation.en: I learned that the Lane-Theobald family had some issues back in the day.
translation.ja: さまざまな問題を抱えた 家族だと分かった

translation.en: People had been arrested, in prison.
translation.ja: 逮捕されて収監されてた

translation.en: My boys, you know, they're boys,
translation.ja: 息子は男の子よ

translation.en: and they're going to have their problems, and they like to fight, and whatever they do.
translation.ja: それぞれに問題があって 戦ったりするわ

translation.en: Even with Belinda, uh, there were drug issues in the past.
translation.ja: ベリンダもドラッグの問題を 抱えてた

translation.en: [Christy] We've been in the drug world together.
translation.ja: ドラッグ仲間よ

translation.en: Using. But I don't want to say all that. Do you want me to say all that?
translation.ja: あまり話したくない クリスティ ベリンダの友人 クリスティ ベリンダの友人 クリスティ ベリンダの友人 聞きたい？

translation.en: Well, you know, it started out a little weekend fun,
translation.ja: 最初は週末の楽しみ程度

translation.en: but then became mama's little helper.
translation.ja: それが必需品になった

translation.en: It was like that's how you go to work and work two jobs, and take care of five kids, and the house.
translation.ja: そうやって２つの仕事と ５人の子育てを乗り切った

translation.en: It was meth. Meth, the devil dope.
translation.ja: 覚醒剤よ　悪魔のドラッグ

translation.en: Go to work, take your line, you know? Come home from work. [scoffs]
translation.ja: 仕事が終わると一服してた

translation.en: I mean, kids were always around, but not seeing. They weren't seeing that.
translation.ja: 子供たちは身近にいたけど 見せてない

translation.en: We weren't doing drugs in front of the kids.
translation.ja: 子供は知らない

translation.en: Uh…
translation.ja: アンブル クリスタルの親友

translation.en: They tried to hide it as much as they could,
translation.ja: アンブル クリスタルの親友 隠そうとしてたけど 全然バレてた

translation.en: but it was super obvious.
translation.ja: 隠そうとしてたけど 全然バレてた

translation.en: Yeah, then, the bigger issue was when I was selling drugs and went to prison.
translation.ja: さらに悪いことに 売人をやって刑務所に行った

translation.en: [Rick] She's had dealings with the police in the past for her own issues, for her son's issues.
translation.ja: 彼女は自分も息子も 警察の世話になってた

translation.en: Yeah. Yeah. I… I sold a lot. I did a lot of damage out there.
translation.ja: そうね　たくさん売った ひどいことした

translation.en: All of Riverside, I… I did.
translation.ja: リバーサイド中よ

translation.en: I've put a lot of drugs on the streets. A lot.
translation.ja: あちこちでドラッグを売った

translation.en: And all Crystal ever asked her, all the time when she was younger,
translation.ja: クリスタルが小さい頃 いつも言ってた

translation.en: was, "Mom, please, quit using. Please, please, please."
translation.ja: “ママ お願い　もうやめて”

translation.en: So now the idea of who might be responsible for this opens up a little bit more.
translation.ja: これで誰が犯人なのか 分からなくなった

translation.en: That, is it something from somebody's past issues in prison? Is it somebody's past issues with gangs?
translation.ja: 刑務所がらみの事件か ギャングがらみか

translation.en: Is it somebody owed somebody money, or drugs, or, you know,
translation.ja: カネやドラッグの 貸し借りの問題か

translation.en: all of a sudden now the world of possibility opens up even further,
translation.ja: 被害者の家族にも 疑わしい点があり

translation.en: because there's this compromising situation with the victim family.
translation.ja: さまざまな可能性が出てきた

translation.en: [Jaimie] Every day. Get out of school, walk straight home.
translation.ja: 毎日 学校から家に直行した

translation.en: Hours upon hours.
translation.ja: 何時間も―

translation.en: From three o'clock in the afternoon till one o'clock in the morning, I'd be on there.
translation.ja: 午後３時から朝の１時まで ずっといた

translation.en: I think it got harder for me
translation.ja: クリスタルのページを作ると おばさんに言われて

translation.en: when my Aunt Belinda came up with the idea of making Crystal a MySpace.
translation.ja: クリスタルのページを作ると おばさんに言われて つらくなった

translation.en: [Belinda] Rebecca just wasn't getting us enough hits from the ones that we were interested in.
translation.ja: レベッカは男たちの興味を 引かなかったから

translation.en: And so I asked her, "Can you put Crystal's picture up there?"
translation.ja: クリスタルの写真を 載せるよう頼んだ

translation.en: [Jaimie] I said, "Crystal. Why do you want to make Crystal a MySpace?"
translation.ja: “なぜクリスタル？”と 聞くと―

translation.en: Make them fall in love with her.
translation.ja: “好きにさせる”と

translation.en: [Belinda] We decided to name her Angel.
translation.ja: エンジェルと名付けた

translation.en: And I wrote on her profile
translation.ja: プロフィールには―

translation.en: that I was going to be their biggest life mistake and their deepest, darkest, best-kept secret.
translation.ja: 後悔するような思い出を 作ってあげると書いた

translation.en: And, boy, they just started responding.
translation.ja: すると反応が増えた

translation.en: It's like, boy, just left then right, ping, ping, ping.
translation.ja: どんどん連絡が来た

translation.en: I'd be on there switching back and forth. I'd have two pages open.
translation.ja: ２つのページを 行ったり来たりした

translation.en: I would just minimize one, go to Angel, minimize the other, go to Rebecca.

translation.ja: 撃たれたのか 撃ったのか知らないが―

translation.en: If I was involved in a shooting… -I think they shot at us. -[Rick] …I would remember.
translation.ja: もし私が銃撃されたら 忘れない

translation.en: [Manuel] And he asked me again.
translation.ja: 再び聞かれた

translation.en: "We know everything."
translation.ja: “全部 知ってる”

translation.en: "You're the only one that's not talking."
translation.ja: “君だけ口を閉ざしてる”

translation.en: [Rick] You told me you didn't know and you weren't in the car. Now I know that's all lies.
translation.ja: 何も知らないと言ってたが ウソだろ

translation.en: 'Cause you're telling me that my brother's over here, then you let us talk a bit.
translation.ja: ここに弟を呼んで 話をさせただろ

translation.en: Then he's coming telling me, "You gotta tell them this and this."
translation.ja: 弟は“何か話したら 刑務所に入れられる”と

translation.en: -"'Cause then he's gonna lock you up." -[Rick] He was being honest about it.
translation.ja: 弟は“何か話したら 刑務所に入れられる”と 弟は正直に答えた

translation.en: He didn't hide anything. He said, "I was there."
translation.ja: 何も隠さなかった　彼は…

translation.en: [Manuel] He goes, "Your brother is in the other room." "And he told us everything."
translation.ja: “君の弟が全て話した”と 彼は言った

translation.en: -[Rick] Is this the front of the car? -Yeah. The front of the car.
translation.ja: これが前？ ああ　車の前方だ

translation.en: [Rick] Okay.
translation.ja: そうか

translation.en: This is me. This is my brother. We're the only ones in the back.
translation.ja: これが僕　こっちが兄 僕らは後ろにいた

translation.en: -[Rick] You're in the very back? -Yeah.
translation.ja: 最後部？ ああ

translation.en: [Rick] This is William Lemus, his drawing.
translation.ja: ウィリアム･レムスが描いた

translation.en: So you can see he's talking about Jokes and Huero.
translation.ja: ジョークスとフエロがいる

translation.en: Jokes said, "These people were in the car,"
translation.ja: 車の同乗者は ジョークスの話と一致する

translation.en: William Lemus confirmed the same thing. Stories were starting to look the same.
translation.ja: 車の同乗者は ジョークスの話と一致する 裏付けが取れた

translation.en: Vehicles were the same. Shooter was the same.
translation.ja: 車も撃った人も同じ

translation.en: He fired one kind of high, and then he pointed at the car.
translation.ja: 彼は空中に一発撃って 銃を車に向けた

translation.en: -Yeah. -Bam, bam, bam, bam.
translation.ja: バン バン バン

translation.en: -And those hit the car. -Those hit the car. Okay.
translation.ja: 車に当たった そうだ

translation.en: That's him. It's not me.
translation.ja: 弟だ　俺じゃない

translation.en: "We're going to bring him in here." Okay.
translation.ja: 弟を連れてくると そうか

translation.en: [Rick] Let's see if we can talk with him.
translation.ja: 一緒に話そう

translation.en: [Manuel] They brought him in. And right there, in that instant,
translation.ja: 弟が入ってきた その瞬間―

translation.en: I wanted to lunge at him…
translation.ja: 突進したかった

translation.en: and just attack my brother.
translation.ja: やっつけたかった

translation.en: The rules say, "You don't say anything."
translation.ja: 何も話さない決まりだ

translation.en: -[Rick] You're telling me the truth? -[Manuel] They will kill him.
translation.ja: 殺される

translation.en: [Rick] The other way, you're lying.
translation.ja: ウソをついてる

translation.en: So you want to lie to me in the middle of a murder investigation? Roll the dice.
translation.ja: 殺人事件の捜査で ウソをついたら疑われるぞ

translation.en: Or tell the truth, and tell me what actually happened.
translation.ja: 真実を話す方が賢い

translation.en: It doesn't get any more black and white.
translation.ja: 選択肢は２つだ

translation.en: I know I didn't kill anybody.
translation.ja: 俺は殺してない

translation.en: [Rick] So, fine. Tell me what happened.
translation.ja: それなら話してくれ

translation.en: [Manuel] I was like, "It's okay. You're not gonna get one word from me."
translation.ja: 俺は決めてた “一言も話さない”

translation.en: [inhales deeply] And they released us.
translation.ja: 解放された

translation.en: When they released us…
translation.ja: 外に出てすぐ―

translation.en: I looked at my brother, and I told him, "I don't know what you just did."
translation.ja: 弟に言った “何てことをしたんだ”と

translation.en: I already knew the gang wants to kill me and my brother.
translation.ja: 俺と弟は ギャングに命を狙われる

translation.en: Well, one day, or should I say one night…
translation.ja: ある日 というか ある夜―

translation.en: 5150 did a meeting.
translation.ja: 5150で会合があった

translation.en: They were talking and telling us, "Hey, it was your brother, wasn't it?"
translation.ja: 〝お前の弟だろ？〞と 聞いてきた 〝お前の弟だろ？〞と 聞いてきた 〝２００６年７月30日〞

translation.en: "I don't know. He wasn't in the same room. He was in a different room."
translation.ja: 〝２００６年７月30日〞 〝２００６年７月30日〞 俺は〝別の部屋に いたから知らない〞と 俺は〝別の部屋に いたから知らない〞と

translation.en: "Why was he in a different room? Why was he longer?
translation.ja: “なぜ別の部屋だった？ なぜ長かった？”

translation.en: Why did you get out, and then he got out right when you got out?"
translation.ja: “なぜお前が出てすぐ 弟も出てきた？”

translation.en: "I don't know."
translation.ja: “知らない”

translation.en: "What would you do if I killed your brother?"
translation.ja: “弟を殺したらどうする？”

translation.en: "Would you be okay with it?"
translation.ja: “構わないか？”

translation.en: I looked at him and I was like…
translation.ja: 俺は彼を見て言った

translation.en: "I would do exactly the same thing you'd do if someone killed your brother."
translation.ja: “お前の弟が殺された時と 同じことをする”

translation.en: So I made my choice right there and then.
translation.ja: その時 決断した

translation.en: I'm out.
translation.ja: 俺は抜ける

translation.en: And I just walked away.
translation.ja: 俺は立ち去った

translation.en: I wanted my brother to be okay.
translation.ja: 弟が心配だった

translation.en: I went with my brother, and we left to L.A.
translation.ja: 弟と一緒にＬＡに行った

translation.en: Well, if they couldn't get us, I knew they were gonna try to get my mom and dad.
translation.ja: 俺たちがいなければ 両親が狙われる

translation.en: I told my mom and dad to get out of there.
translation.ja: 逃げるよう言った

translation.en: Mom and Dad didn't listen.
translation.ja: だが聞かなかった

translation.en: [operator] Sir, what is your address, please?
translation.ja: 住所は？

translation.en: [Will] 3445 Glasgow.
translation.ja: グラスゴー 3445

translation.en: [Betty] A bunch of kids all dressed in black.
translation.ja: 〈黒づくめの子供が 大勢いる〉

translation.en: Maybe they weren't kids. I couldn't tell, they were so far away.
translation.ja: 〈子供じゃないかも 遠くて見えなかった〉

translation.en: [operator] Okay, and how many kids are you talking about?
translation.ja: 子供は何人いますか

translation.en: [Will] About ten, 12.
My husband called the police, and they asked, "Are you going to stay there?"
translation.ja: 〈夫が警察に通報すると “家に残るか”聞かれた〉

translation.en: "No, how can I stay here?" he said. "We're leaving, send someone to check."
translation.ja: 〈夫は“ムリだ 誰か見にきてくれ”と〉

translation.en: -[operator] What is your name? -[Will] My name is William Lemus,
translation.ja: お名前は？ ウィリアム･レムス

translation.en: but I do not want to get involved in this.
translation.ja: だが俺は関わりたくない

translation.en: [operator] You don't want the officer to knock?
translation.ja: 警察の連絡は断る？

translation.en: [Will] Of course not.
translation.ja: そうだ

translation.en: [Betty] We were able to leave, we left.
translation.ja: 〈私たちは逃げられたけど〉

translation.en: But we did not know what they were going to do.
translation.ja: 〈何をされるか 分からなかった〉

translation.en: [Manuel] I have a feeling that if my mom would have not left, they probably would've burned them alive.
translation.ja: 両親が逃げなかったら 焼き殺されてたと思う

translation.en: [Betty] All the sentimental things.
translation.ja: 〈思い出の品が〉

translation.en: But since I am Christian, the Bible says, "The thoughts of man are not the same as those of God."
translation.ja: 〈私はクリスチャンだから 神の考えを信じる〉

translation.en: [Manuel] Is there such thing as loyalty in this world?
translation.ja: この世に忠誠はあるのか

translation.en: It means nothing, actually.
translation.ja: 何の意味もない

translation.en: [Rick] All right, Manuel, your dad said you wanna talk more?
translation.ja: 話があると 君の父さんに聞いた

translation.en: -Yeah. -[Rick] Okay. To remind you…
translation.ja: ああ そうか…

translation.en: [Manuel] When they tried to do something to my mom and dad, I said,
translation.ja: 彼らの両親への仕打ちを 知って決心した

translation.en: "Okay, fine. Give me the detective. I'll tell him anything he wants to hear."
translation.ja: 彼らの両親への仕打ちを 知って決心した 刑事に全部 話すと

translation.en: Do you remember more of what happened that night?
translation.ja: 事件のことを思い出した？

translation.en: I can tell you the whole story now.
translation.ja: 全部 話すよ

translation.en: [Rick] Okay.
translation.ja: そうか

translation.en: The beginning was that, my friends, I don't know about what time, late at night,
translation.ja: まず 俺の友達が何時か 分からないけど夜遅く―

translation.en: they came knocking at our house.
translation.ja: 俺たちの家に来た

translation.en: So it's nighttime.
translation.ja: 夜の話だ

translation.en: I'm in an SUV.
translation.ja: 俺はＳＵＶに乗ってた

translation.en: A car pulls up.
translation.ja: 車が止まった

translation.en: One of the guys gets out of the car like, "Hey."
translation.ja: 中から１人出てきて言った 中から１人出てきて言った 銃撃の17分前

translation.en: "They tried to kill me."
translation.ja: 銃撃の17分前 銃撃の17分前 “奴らが撃ってきた 娘と一緒だったのに”と

translation.en: "And tried to shoot me with my daughter in the car."
translation.ja: 銃撃の17分前 “奴らが撃ってきた 娘と一緒だったのに”と “奴らが撃ってきた 娘と一緒だったのに”と

translation.en: It's a big SUV, big truck or something.
translation.ja: その車は大きなＳＵＶだった

translation.en: It was MD.
translation.ja: ＭＤの奴らだ

translation.en: Another gang.
translation.ja: 別のギャング

translation.en: Julio, he was determined to do something.
translation.ja: フリオは仕返しを するつもりだった

translation.en: Fuck them. We're taking them out right now.
translation.ja: 奴らをやっつけてやると

translation.en: [Rick] They had shown up in the area of Greenpoint and Geranium
translation.ja: 仲間を撃ったと思われる―

translation.en: looking to retaliate against a rival gang that they thought
translation.ja: ライバルのギャングに 仕返しをしようと グリーンポイントと ゼラニアムの交差点に行った

translation.en: had shot at one of their gang members earlier in the day.
translation.ja: グリーンポイントと ゼラニアムの交差点に行った

translation.en: They didn't know who the Theobalds were. They didn't have any connection with them.
translation.ja: シオボルドとは 何の関係もなかった

translation.en: But they run into Robert's SUV. They see him.
translation.ja: ロバートのＳＵＶと 出くわした

translation.en: I don't know what happened. I was in the SUV sitting there.
translation.ja: 何があったかよく分からない

translation.en: We're parked right here, and he's facing us right here.
translation.ja: 俺たちの車に向き合ってた

translation.en: [Rick] And when Robert takes off, they chase him.
translation.ja: ロバートを追いかけた

translation.en: And it's at that point that they lose him and stop at the intersection of Greenpoint and Geranium.
translation.ja: ロバートを見失った彼らは 交差点に車を止めた

translation.en: Two vehicles drive up to their car that has stopped almost in the middle of the intersection.
translation.ja: ２台の車がやってきて 交差点の近くで止まった

translation.en: And they thought that this was rival gang members coming to attack them.
translation.ja: 彼らはその車が ライバルだと思った

translation.en: [Manuel] Julio gets out of the SUV, and walks in the middle of the road.
translation.ja: フリオは車から出て 道の真ん中に行った

translation.en: By that moment, he's pulling out his piece and just fired away.
translation.ja: その時 彼は銃を持ってて 撃ち放った

translation.en: The one round that struck Crystal caught her in the back of the head,
translation.ja: クリスタルは 後頭部を撃たれた

translation.en: kind of just around the neckline.
translation.ja: 首の後ろあたり

translation.en: And, um, that would've been one of the final rounds that was fired
translation.ja: 彼女が撃たれたのは 最後の銃撃で

translation.en: as the vehicle's leaving the area.
translation.ja: 車は立ち去った

translation.en: And then four blocks ahead, we see it pull over.
translation.ja: ４ブロック先で車が止まった

translation.en: We already knew someone got hit.
translation.ja: 誰か撃たれてた

translation.en: -[Rick] Out, like outside? -[Manuel] Yeah.
translation.ja: 外ってこと？ ああ

translation.en: -Lil Huero. -[Rick] Just Lil Huero?
translation.ja: フエロ 彼だけ？

translation.en: -Just him. -[Rick] Okay.
translation.ja: ああ そうか

translation.en: [Rick] I developed a rapport with William Lemus and Manuel,
translation.ja: ウィリアムやマニュエルと 信頼関係を築いた

translation.en: to where I feel like they trusted that I had their best interests at heart.
translation.ja: 私が親身になってると 分かってもらえた

translation.en: I stood up, and I turned around so he could see from behind. I wasn't wearing a wire.
translation.ja: 立ち上がって 盗聴器がないと見せた

translation.en: And they could be my very key witnesses in this case.
translation.ja: 彼らは重要な証人になる

translation.en: He'd be on the passenger side, but in the seat behind.
translation.ja: 彼は助手席に乗ってたんだな

translation.en: [Rick] That pushed everything into the area that this will end up in a courtroom. Somebody's gonna be held responsible.
translation.ja: これで裁判に持ち込める 犯人を罪に問える

translation.en: [officer] Police Department! Search warrant!
translation.ja: クリスタルの死から １年半 クリスタルの死から １年半 警察だ　捜索する 警察だ　捜索する

translation.en: [Rick] We ended up doing a large gang sweep with a whole bunch of agencies.
translation.ja: 大がかりな 一斉摘発を行った

translation.en: [reporter] Police carried out gang association search warrants.
translation.ja: 警察は一斉捜査を行いました

translation.en: Somewhere in the neighborhood of 25 to 30 houses were hit all at the same time on a particular morning.
translation.ja: ある朝 近隣の25〜30軒が 一斉に捜査された

translation.en: [reporter] "This was a reign of terror," said the D.A. "I think we took the gang apart on Wednesday."
translation.ja: 地方検事は“恐怖の治世を 一掃できたと思う”と

translation.en: [Rick] The guys that were working the intel for Julio Heredia
translation.ja: メキシコ　ロサリト メキシコ　ロサリト フリオ･ヘレディアの 捜査筋から情報が入った フリオ･ヘレディアの 捜査筋から情報が入った

translation.en: called and said, "We've got a line on where he's at."
translation.ja: “彼の居所が分かった”と

translation.en: Julio woke up one day surrounded with cops.
translation.ja: ある日フリオが目覚めると 警察に囲まれてた

translation.en: And they were Mexican cops.
translation.ja: メキシコの警察だ

translation.en: I'm wanting to say it was within a day. I think we got him up here.
translation.ja: それから１日で 彼を連れてきた

translation.en: Today we take back our park, our streets, our neighborhood,
translation.ja: 私たちの公園や道路 地域を取り戻し

translation.en: and a part of our community and return it to the rightful owners.
translation.ja: 真の所有者にお返しします

translation.en: [Belinda] There's no justice. Justice would be
translation.ja: 正義はない クリスタルが戻らないかぎり

translation.en: if they could find a way to bring Crystal back to us.
translation.ja: クリスタルが戻らないかぎり

translation.en: News vans rolled up. I was just, like, wow.
translation.ja: マスコミに取り囲まれて 圧倒された

translation.en: [reporter] Her engagement on social media gleaned information that eventually helped lead police to arrests.
translation.ja: 母親が集めた情報が 逮捕につながりました

translation.en: [Belinda] We were notified the night before
translation.ja: 前日の夜に知らされた

translation.en: that Julio Heredia had been charged with my daughter's murder,
translation.ja: フリオ･ヘレディアが 娘の殺害容疑で起訴されたと

translation.en: and that he was in custody.
translation.ja: 彼は拘束されたと

translation.en: It was like, "Thank you, Jesus. Thank you. They got him. They got him."
translation.ja: 神に感謝した 犯人が逮捕された

translation.en: [Rick] You're looking at a murder charge, and you're that…
translation.ja: 殺人の容疑がかけられてる

translation.en: Are you that confident? I'm looking at you.
translation.ja: 殺人の容疑がかけられてる 確かなのか？

translation.en: I can tell you're not confident.
translation.ja: 確かなのか？

translation.en: No, I'm sure about this. I'm thinking about other things.
translation.ja: 間違いない　考え事をしてた

translation.en: [Rick] What are you thinking about? Anna?
translation.ja: 何のこと？ アンナのこと？

translation.en: -That kid she's carrying? -Yup.
translation.ja: おなかの子？ ああ

translation.en: [Rick] There's a lot of stuff in your life right now.
translation.ja: いろいろ大変な時期だ

translation.en: How far along is she now?
translation.ja: 今 何ヵ月？

translation.en: -Four months. -[Rick] Four months?
translation.ja: ４ヵ月

translation.en: -Little boy or little girl? Do you know? -No.
translation.ja: 男か女 分かってる？ いや

translation.en: [Rick] How is she doing?
translation.ja: 彼女は？

translation.en: She's good.
translation.ja: 元気だ

translation.en: [Rick] You got a four-month-old on the way.
translation.ja: もうすぐ子供が産まれる

translation.en: Set the example and step up and be a man about this.
translation.ja: 潔く罪を認めたらどうだ？

translation.en: You made a mistake. Everybody makes mistakes.
translation.ja: 君は過ちを犯した 大なり小なり みんな間違いを犯す

translation.en: Some of them are bigger than others.
translation.ja: 大なり小なり みんな間違いを犯す

translation.en: But right here, right now is the chance for you to make a change.
translation.ja: 今ここで やり直すことができる

translation.en: For you to be a different kind of a person, Julio.
translation.ja: 違う人間になれる

translation.en: You want to sleep on it tonight?
translation.ja: 一晩 考える？

translation.en: No, I just want to… Yeah, I want a freaking lawyer.
translation.ja: 俺はただ… 弁護士を呼んでくれ 俺の権利だろ

translation.en: I want you to give me my rights. I want somebody to be right here.
translation.ja: 弁護士を呼んでくれ 俺の権利だろ

translation.en: [Rick] Now you want a lawyer? You can have an attorney if you want.
translation.ja: 弁護士か 望むなら弁護士を呼ぶよ

translation.en: You wanna do that? That's fine.
translation.ja: 望むなら弁護士を呼ぶよ

translation.en: -But now you got a lot to think about. -You don't understand me anyways.
translation.ja: だが よく考えて どうせ分からないさ

translation.en: [Diallo] I would describe Riverside as kind of the Wild West
translation.ja: “公設弁護人 法律事務所” リバーサイドの 刑事司法制度は

translation.en: of the criminal justice system as far as here in Southern California.
translation.ja: 西部開拓のようなもの 西部開拓のようなもの スレイ･ディアロ フリオの弁護士

translation.en: An intense place to practice.
translation.ja: スレイ･ディアロ フリオの弁護士 厳しい地域だ

translation.en: The DA's office, they have a reputation. You know, we're aggressive about gang prosecutions.
translation.ja: 検察はギャングの起訴に 強気な姿勢だ

translation.en: So aggressive to the fact we're looking to put gang members to death.
translation.ja: ギャングメンバーを 死刑にしたがる

translation.en: You know, on our side we're representing Julio, and trying to convey his humanity and his interests,
translation.ja: 私はフリオの担当だから 彼の人権や利益を代弁する

translation.en: but they have to have a tough decision to a family who's lost somebody.
translation.ja: だが検察は被害者のため 厳しく対応する

translation.en: [Rick] Now we bring the family in, and we talk with the DA's office about if it'll be the death penalty.
translation.ja: 家族を呼んで検察局で 死刑にするか話し合った

translation.en: I know Belinda was very, very passionate. She wanted him to pay the ultimate price for it.
translation.ja: ベリンダが極刑を 望んでるのは分かってた

translation.en: Um, and I don't blame her. I don't blame her at all.
translation.ja: それも当然だと思う

translation.en: [Belinda] Yeah, I hate him. I hate him.
translation.ja: 〝リバーサイド　殺人〞 〝リバーサイド　殺人〞 とにかく大嫌い

translation.en: I do.
translation.ja: 嫌いよ

translation.en: There's… I can't think of anything in the world bad enough
translation.ja: 何をして償っても―

translation.en: that would be enough.
translation.ja: 許せない

translation.en: Capital cases, your whole mind frame is changed to saving a person's life.
translation.ja: 死刑裁判では命を救うことに 意識が向けられる

translation.en: So that person's entire life has to be investigated
translation.ja: 被告の全人生が調査される

translation.en: because ultimately, you're not just killing that part of the person that committed the crime. You're killing all of them.
translation.ja: 罪を犯した部分だけでなく 全てを殺すことになるから

translation.en: Their story has to be told. How they got to where they were.
translation.ja: 被告の人生を語る必要がある

translation.en: You know, not excuses but explanations.
translation.ja: 言い訳ではなく説明が必要

translation.en: [chuckles] He was so small in this picture. He was so tiny.
translation.ja: この写真の兄は すごく小さいわ

translation.en: His big, old ears.
translation.ja: 耳が大きかった

translation.en: I remember them sending us out.
translation.ja: 書類が送られてきた

translation.en: The papers that we have to fill out, like if you're 18 and older,
translation.ja: アマリア フリオ･ヘレディアの妹 アマリア フリオ･ヘレディアの妹 18歳以上の者は 署名をすれば 18歳以上の者は 署名をすれば

translation.en: and if you want to go to the execution, you can.
translation.ja: 執行を見に行くことができる

translation.en: Oh, my mom.
translation.ja: まあ ママだわ

translation.en: It was hard living with my mom.
translation.ja: ママとの生活は大変だった

translation.en: You know, she was on drugs and alcohol, and…
translation.ja: ドラッグとお酒に溺れてた

translation.en: I mean, I would pick stuff up off the floor, eating it
translation.ja: 下に落ちてるものを 拾って食べた

translation.en: 'cause we were so hungry.
translation.ja: 空腹だったから

translation.en: So that brings… Seeing this picture brings back a lot of bad memories.
translation.ja: この写真を見てると イヤな思い出がよみがえる

translation.en: We didn't have food. We didn't have furniture.
translation.ja: 食べ物も家具もなかった

translation.en: Julio, he had to take care of all of us, getting money, working.
translation.ja: フリオがお金を稼いで 私たちの世話をした

translation.en: For me, the only father figure I ever had was Julio.
translation.ja: 私にとってフリオは 父親のような存在

translation.en: [Mario] You know, with Julio, we looked up to him.
translation.ja: フリオを尊敬してた

translation.en: We wanted to be like him. We would dress like him. [chuckles]
translation.ja: 彼のようになりたかった

translation.en: You know, we were proud.
translation.ja: 誇らしかった

translation.en: We would go to school, and we'd tell everybody, "That's our cousin."
translation.ja: マリオ　フリオのいとこ 元５１５０メンバー 学校で自慢してた 〝僕らのいとこだ〞と 学校で自慢してた 〝僕らのいとこだ〞と

translation.en: This is where we lived up here, and he lived over there across the street.
translation.ja: 僕らの家はここで フリオは向かいに住んでた

translation.en: That was his last spot where, like, he actually, like, lived with his mom.
translation.ja: あそこは彼が母親と 暮らした最後の場所

translation.en: Uh, Julio was 14, 15, then.
translation.ja: フリオは14歳か15歳だった

translation.en: I think he couldn't accept that his mom just didn't care to get them back.
translation.ja: 母親に見捨てられた事実が 受け入れられなかった

translation.en: You know, she didn't try to get them back.
translation.ja: 彼女は子供を 取り戻そうとしなかった

translation.en: See, this picture just reminds me, like, of when they started,
translation.ja: この写真を見ると思い出す 外で遊んでトラブルに 巻き込まれるようになった

translation.en: you know, going out and getting involved in all that stuff.
translation.ja: 外で遊んでトラブルに 巻き込まれるようになった

translation.en: [Mario] He started hanging out with the older guys. And those are guys who would let him in his house. And they gave him drugs.
translation.ja: 年上の人と遊ぶようになり ドラッグを与えられた

translation.en: And, you know, uh, they started having him do things that he shouldn't have been doing.
translation.ja: 法に反すことを させられるようになった

translation.en: Oh, this has everybody in it.
translation.ja: あら 全員 写ってる

translation.en: They all look so young in this picture.
translation.ja: みんなすごく若い

translation.en: [Mario] This guy stabbed him with this huge kitchen knife.
translation.ja: フリオは 大きな包丁で刺されたが

translation.en: And Julio's skinny, so the knife, like, came out his back.
translation.ja: 痩せてたから包丁が貫通した

translation.en: That's when I started realizing he wasn't, um, the same anymore.
translation.ja: その頃から今までの 彼とは違うと気付いた

translation.en: Like, his joy was gone. It was, like, done, dead.
translation.ja: 喜びは消えて 死んでしまった

translation.en: Nick even said, "Mom, I don't like this fucker."
translation.ja: ニックもイヤな奴だと 言ってた

translation.en: He goes, "Yeah, I fucking don't like him."
translation.ja: “あんな奴 大嫌いだ”

translation.en: "But, Mom, you got to think, when I was 17, I didn't give a fuck."
translation.ja: “でも俺が17歳の時は どうでもよかった”

translation.en: [Nick] I was into sports. I mean, playing football and going to ride my dirt bike.
translation.ja: スポーツが好きだった アメフトや自転車

translation.en: And after Crystal was killed, I started having problems at school with fighting,
translation.ja: クリスタルが殺されて 世の中に腹が立って学校で 問題を起こすようになった

translation.en: in a bad mood, and mad at the world, I guess I could say.
translation.ja: 世の中に腹が立って学校で 問題を起こすようになった

translation.en: And he started messing up. He was angry. He wanted revenge.
translation.ja: おかしくなった 怒って復讐(ふくしゅう)しようとした

translation.en: And we were losing him to a gang.
translation.ja: ギャングに 取られそうになった

translation.en: -[interviewer] Which son? -Nicholas.
translation.ja: ニックよ

translation.en: Yeah, like, I was from a gang, and we were enemies with the 5150s and stuff.
translation.ja: 俺はギャングだ 5150は俺の敵だと

translation.en: I just fit in right with them. Like, fuck them fools too, you know? Like let's go look for them and…
translation.ja: 彼らとは馬が合った 奴らを探しに行こうぜと

translation.en: [Belinda] Now I have the fear and worry about my son being killed in gang violence
translation.ja: 自分の息子がギャング闘争で 殺されるかもしれない

translation.en: and being a part of a gang, or killing somebody.
translation.ja: ギャングの一員になって 誰かを殺すかも

translation.en: [Nick] When I was a juvenile, I was arrested a lot.
translation.ja: 若い頃はよく逮捕された

translation.en: I mean, I have the gun case, then I'm up for assault with a firearm.
translation.ja: 銃の事件だ 銃を使って暴行した

translation.en: That's what I got out of prison for, and it's just not worth it.
translation.ja: それで刑務所に入った バカらしい

translation.en: You stay in denial a little bit.
translation.ja: 現実逃避する

translation.en: You don't wanna believe that your child…
translation.ja: 自分の子供が そんなことするなんて

translation.en: could do something like that. Get a gun.
translation.ja: 自分の子供が そんなことするなんて いったいどこで 銃を手に入れたの？

translation.en: I'm like, "How did you get a gun? Where did you get a gun?"
translation.ja: いったいどこで 銃を手に入れたの？

translation.en: This was my bottom.
translation.ja: 最悪だった

translation.en: This…
translation.ja: これで―

translation.en: This was Belinda's wake-up call.
translation.ja: 私は目が覚めた

translation.en: I had to really start taking a good look at myself,
translation.ja: 自分を見つめ直した

translation.en: and why I was having all of these… these feelings, and just being pissed off at the world.
translation.ja: なぜこんなにも激しく 世の中に怒りを感じてるのか

translation.en: And… where is the anger coming from?
translation.ja: その怒りはどこから来るのか

translation.en: What… What is it I'm mad at?
translation.ja: 何に怒ってる？

translation.en: Well, I was mad at me. I was mad at me.
translation.ja: 私は自分に怒ってた

translation.en: I was disappointed in me.
translation.ja: 自分に落胆してた

translation.en: Who's that? You guys, get down!
translation.ja: 誰なの？　伏せて

translation.en: I think they're coming up the road again. Get behind the car, Ben. Hurry!
translation.ja: また戻ってくる 車の後ろに行って

translation.en: [dispatcher] Wait. Ma'am, hold on. Do you think he was a teenager?
translation.ja: ちょっと待って 子供でした？

translation.en: [Belinda] The last day I used was the day Crystal was murdered.
translation.ja: 最後に使ったのは クリスタルが殺された日

translation.en: Yeah. I was high.
translation.ja: 私はハイだった

translation.en: -He was shorter than me. -[dispatcher] Thin, medium, heavy build?
translation.ja: 背は低い どんな体格？

translation.en: Oh gosh, uh…
translation.ja: もうやだ…

translation.en: And that's all Crystal ever wanted from me.
translation.ja: クリスタルの 唯一の願いだった

translation.en: "Mom, just get sober."
translation.ja: “ドラッグはやめて”

translation.en: My heart's still pounding. I'm just like, "Oh my God. I can't believe this."
translation.ja: 心臓がドキドキしてる 信じられない

translation.en: And I couldn't do it for her. I couldn't do it for her in life.
translation.ja: 娘が生きてるうちは できなかった

translation.en: I have to learn to forgive myself.
translation.ja: 自分を許せるのか

translation.en: And that's harder than forgiving… Julio Heredia. It really is.
translation.ja: フリオ･ヘレディアを 許すことより難しい

translation.en: [woman] Just memorials of all the murders in Riverside County.
translation.ja: 〝犠牲者の声は届く〞 〝犠牲者の声は届く〞 リバーサイドの犠牲者よ

translation.en: [Belinda] Every single day, it's on the news.
translation.ja: 毎日ニュースになってる

translation.en: It's just the names are changing.
translation.ja: 〝クリスタル･ シオボルド〞 名前が変わるだけ

translation.en: I can understand where the drugs, gangs, and they were all high as a kite that night too.
translation.ja: あの日もドラッグで ギャングたちは興奮してた

translation.en: I can actually say, "There go I, but for the grace of God."
translation.ja: 私は神のご加護を 祈るしかできない

translation.en: That was really the reason that we asked him to take the death penalty off the table.
translation.ja: だから死刑を 取り下げるよう頼んだ

translation.en: I did the right thing for the first time in my life. I did the right thing. Yeah.
translation.ja: 人生で初めて 正しいことをした

translation.en: If you've got gang members that are definitely loyal to their gang
translation.ja: 〝リバーサイド裁判所〞 忠誠心に厚い ギャングメンバーは 忠誠心に厚い ギャングメンバーは

translation.en: and know the price that they pay if they snitch,
translation.ja: 密告することの 代償を知ってる

translation.en: it's pretty rare that you get one, maybe two to be cooperative with us.
translation.ja: 協力してくれる人を 見つけることは難しい

translation.en: So that was huge.
translation.ja: だから助かった

translation.en: [Manuel] By the time he hears the gunshot, he comes outside of the car.
translation.ja: 銃声が聞こえて彼は外に出た

translation.en: He's coming out.
translation.ja: 外に出た

translation.en: And at this time, I hear several other gunshot noises.
translation.ja: それから何発か 銃声が聞こえた

translation.en: I was kind of scared because of the fact that…
translation.ja: 知ってるからこそ 恐ろしくなる

translation.en: I know how many people are in this organization.
translation.ja: 大勢がこの組織に関わってる

translation.en: And it's not something that you end.
translation.ja: 終わりはない

translation.en: [woman] You've seen Little Huero on meth?
translation.ja: フエロは覚醒剤を？

translation.en: -[Manuel] Yeah. -[woman] You've never smoked with him?
translation.ja: ああ 一緒に？

translation.en: [Manuel] Never smoked with him, never seen him do it,
translation.ja: 見てないけど やってるのは確かだ

translation.en: but I know he's on it, his eyeballs are all opened up.
translation.ja: 見てないけど やってるのは確かだ 目つきで分かる

translation.en: It was just crazy to see them testifying against my brother, you know?
translation.ja: 兄に反する証言をするのは 変な気分

translation.en: 'Cause they grew up with us, you know?
translation.ja: 一緒に育った人よ

translation.en: They were always there. They were always at our house.
translation.ja: いつも一緒にいた

translation.en: [Will] So I saw when Little Huero dumped the first shot. I didn't see the other shots. I saw the first one.
translation.ja: フエロが最初に 発砲したのを見た

translation.en: I did feel hurt, you know? Because we would hang out every day,
translation.ja: 傷つけられた気がした 仲良しだったが

translation.en: and I just thought, for you to make up lies just to get out of something.
translation.ja: 何かから逃れるために ウソをつくなんて

translation.en: [interviewer] Did you have interactions with them? Did they talk to you?
translation.ja: 彼らと話したりした？

translation.en: Not at all. They were just looking at me, but I didn't want to look at them.
translation.ja: 全然　見られてたけど 俺は見なかった

translation.en: [Amalia] I think it was Manuel's crying, um, when he was testifying, so…
translation.ja: 証言する時 マニュエルは泣いてたと思う

translation.en: [Manuel] I know he didn't mean to do all those things he did.
translation.ja: 彼は意図して やったわけではない

translation.en: Like how everyone in this world doesn't mean to do it.
translation.ja: 誰だってそんなこと望まない

translation.en: [Amalia] The comments that the judge made were really harsh.
translation.ja: 判事のコメントは厳しかった

translation.en: "Mr. Heredia is not a good person."
translation.ja: “ヘレディアさんは悪人”

translation.en: "He is a violent, cold-blooded murderer."
translation.ja: “ヘレディアさんは悪人” “暴力的で冷血な殺人者だ”

translation.en: "And he is going to pay for what he has done."
translation.ja: “自分の行いを 償ってもらう”

translation.en: [Manuel] We lived in the fast lane.
translation.ja: 起訴されなかった 起訴されなかった 生き急いでた 起訴されなかった

translation.en: We did things that you can't even think of.
translation.ja: 起訴されなかった とんでもないことをしてきた とんでもないことをしてきた

translation.en: For those things, we get nightmares.
translation.ja: そのことでうなされる

translation.en: [Justin] I live it every day. I can't… drive down the street where I grew up…
translation.ja: 生まれ育った道を 運転してると―

translation.en: [voice breaks] without flashing back.
translation.ja: つい思い出してしまう

translation.en: [Robbie] I've had dreams about her, just…
translation.ja: 妹が夢に出てきた

translation.en: I just hold tight to all my memories.
translation.ja: ずっと忘れないよ

translation.en: [Jaimie] It was about a month ago.
translation.ja: １ヵ月くらい前

translation.en: Crystal was standing there.
translation.ja: クリスタルが立ってた

translation.en: And she was in this white dress.
translation.ja: 白いドレスを来てた

translation.en: And then I woke up.
translation.ja: そこで目覚めた

translation.en: [Manuel] Now it's going to be difficult forgiving myself.
translation.ja: 自分を許すのは難しい

translation.en: Mom and Dad always try to protect me,
translation.ja: 両親はいつも 俺を守ってくれた

translation.en: always try to have something good for me.
translation.ja: 俺のために尽くしてくれた

translation.en: And I'm… I'm trying not to let them down again.
translation.ja: もう落胆させたくない

translation.en: I want to have kids. Raise a family.
translation.ja: 子供が欲しい 家族を作りたい

translation.en: You know, do something.
translation.ja: 何か成し遂げたい

translation.en: [Belinda] It was personal between William Sotelo and I.
translation.ja: ウィリアム･ソテロには 個人的恨みがある

translation.en: It's not over until he's apprehended.
translation.ja: 奴が逮捕されるまで 終わらない

translation.en: And I feel like I just need him in custody so Crystal can rest.
translation.ja: 奴を捕まえないと クリスタルが安らげない

translation.en: Let's see what William Sotelo…
translation.ja: ウィリアム･ソテロは…

translation.en: Oh, and Unity.
translation.ja: “統一性”ね

translation.en: It shows me that wherever he is, he's not doing too badly.
translation.ja: どこにいたとしても 悪くない生活をしてる

translation.en: This is beautiful. The High Priestess.
translation.ja: いいわ　“女教皇”

translation.en: Now this would represent me.
translation.ja: これが私よ

translation.en: And it shows that I'm wise enough to take the steps to move forward in my life.
translation.ja: 人生で前に進むために 賢く振る舞えると出てる

translation.en: And I'm to listen to my intuition and have patience
translation.ja: 自分の直感を信じて 我慢できる

translation.en: and consider carefully what I want before I act.
translation.ja: 行動する前に 自分が望むことを熟慮する

translation.en: And then the Justice card.
translation.ja: そして“正義”のカード

translation.en: He's ours. They're going to get him one day.
translation.ja: いつの日か捕まえるわ

translation.en: Better times are coming.
translation.ja: いい兆しよ

translation.en: Yes.
translation.ja: そうよ

translation.en: [Belinda] Justice and revenge.
translation.ja: 逮捕につながった 正義と復讐？ 正義と復讐？

translation.en: Yes, they are just about the same thing.
translation.ja: 似てるようで両者は違う

translation.en: One means you can stay in the free world, and the other means you can go sit in the defendant's chair.
translation.ja: 自由な世界にいるか 被告人席に座るかの選択

translation.en: And that's a line I almost crossed myself.
translation.ja: 私もその一線を 越えそうになった
